page.title: 17NELL FARM,HANNINGTON
page.content: Nell Farm,294 acres in size,is mostly grassland apart from 60 acres of arable land.They have 600 tons of silage.Most of the fields are used for dairy cattle.Mr.and Mrs Williams,the present owners,say that the farm was first established in the 19th century.To buy one acre of land now would cost Â£2000.Animals kept include 60 calves and 110 sheep and lambs,and three thoroughbred horses.They also own 15 hens,one cat and two kittens.The farmer employs one dairyman to help with the milking.
